title: LAIR ORB / shot viscal
description: You decide that the shot that killed the merc couldn't have come from this bunker.

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "Could this have been the killer's h..."
dialogueTree.text: Could this have been the killer's hideout, and this narrow window -- the point of origin of the shot that killed the mercenary?

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "This does look like an *embrasure*,..."
links.text: This does look like an *embrasure*, a slit made for shooting out of.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Outside the window -- another day...."
links.text: Outside the window -- another day. The beach sand soaks up the drizzling rain, growing darker and darker.

links.title: You: "Would this have been a good hideout..."
links.text: Would this have been a good hideout for a sniper?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a great place to hide, certai..."
links.text: "It's a great place to hide, certainly, but there hasn't been anyone here in ages."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a great place to hide, certai..."
links.text: "It's a great place to hide, certainly, but there hasn't been anyone in here for ages."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's a good place to hide, but does..."
links.text: It's a good place to hide, but doesn't look like anyone has stayed here in a while.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's definitely a good place to hid..."
links.text: It's definitely a good place to hide. You barely found it yourself.

links.title: You: "Is it feasible to hit a target in t..."
links.text: Is it feasible to hit a target in the Whirling-in-Rags from this window? (Conclude.)

links.title: Visual Calculus: "No, it's not. No matter how you cra..."
links.text: No, it's not. No matter how you crane your neck, you can't see the whole of the Whirling-in-Rags, and certainly not the relevant segment of the top floor.

links.title: You: ""Kim, I can't see the Whirling-in-R..."
links.text: "Kim, I can't see the Whirling-in-Rags... The shot didn't come from here." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. No one could get a clear v..."
links.text: "Indeed. No one could get a clear view. Well, at least we've been thorough. I like thorough."

links.title: Authority: "The lieutenant's voice betrays a sl..."
links.text: The lieutenant's voice betrays a slight disappointment, which he glosses over by reasserting control.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In fact -- I think we're done with..."
links.text: "In fact -- I think we're done with this bunker." He looks to the exit. "After you, officer."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Outside the window -- desolation. S..."
links.text: Outside the window -- desolation. Snow falls softly onto the coastal sand, where it melts almost instantly. On rooftops, it lingers.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Outside the window -- the day is cl..."
links.text: Outside the window -- the day is clear, and as mild as can be in early spring.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You hear the rain's susurration acr..."
links.text: You hear the rain's susurration across the sea water. The night shudders.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "In the darkness, you can barely mak..."
links.text: In the darkness, you can barely make out the falling snow. It settles, making the night still quieter.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The lights of Martinaise shine cool..."
links.text: The lights of Martinaise shine coolly in the clear night.
